content.value: Your body is akin to a coiling spring, capable of discharging its stored energies to move objects. Even the lightest touch from you is sufficient to transfer this energy, driving back your attackers or sending your foes careening into danger.

You have gained the ability to discharge energy at your foes, propelling them in the direction of your choice. You may use this power whenever you successfully touch your target or succeed in a physical attack against her, which must be an unarmed or melee attack. Spend a single charge of Kineticism to move your target up to 4 steps in the direction of your choice. If this would cause your target to collide with anything the size of a table or larger, she takes 1 point of damage, as do any characters she collides with. This damage is considered separate from your initial attack for the purposes of damage reduction. You may only spend one charge per action in this manner.
Your Discharge moves your target up to 6 steps and causes 2 points of damage if she collides with an object of sufficient size. You may also knock the target prone if you choose.

You have the power to turn kinetic energy into stored energy, later using it to protect yourself from harm. Should you receive a forceful blow, you can absorb a portion of its energy, thereby reducing its effectiveness and recharging your stores.Â

Whenever an opponent achieves an exceptional success in a physical attack where you are the defender, you may spend 2 charges of Kineticism to reduce the exceptional success to a normal success. If your opponent has a power which gives her an automatic exceptional success, activating this power causes them to instead check for an exceptional success normally.

In addition, you may gain a charge of Kineticism whenever a physical attack would harm you for 2 or more points of damage. You may determine if this benefit applies before applying the effects of Fortitude or other powers. If you gain a charge of Kineticism in this way, you may not spend it to apply Kinetic Dampening toward the same attack.

You have the ability to absorb and buffer non-kinetic energies with this power. You may gain a charge whenever any effect would cause you to suffer two or more points of damage, determined before any damage reduction. Likewise, whenever you are the target of a power or effect that scores an exceptional success and would also cause you to take at least 1 point of damage, you may expend 2 charges of Kineticism to reduce it to a normal success.

At its base level, this power does not function against the Chimerstry power Horrid Reality. Further, your inability to absorb energy from the effects of Horrid Reality does not constitute you successfully disbelieving the illusion.

fields.title: Redirection

content.value: Your mastery of Kineticism has expanded to objects beyond your own body. By applying a mix of inertia and acceleration to an object, you can redefine its path, sending it on whatever course you desire.

Whenever you succeed in defending against a firearm or a thrown weapon attack, or whenever you successfully defend against a power which involves a projectile such as Taste of Death, Conflagration, or Flame Bolt, you may spend 2 charges to activate this power. If you do, you may redirect the failed attack to a new target of your choice. Make an opposed challenge against that target using the Kineticism test pool. If you succeed, you may apply the effects of the original power to the new target. This attack counts towards, and must abide by, the maximum attacks per round limitation. You may only use this power during Celerity rounds if you are able to act during that same round. Powers which do not involve an actual projectile, such as Force Bolt or Engulf, cannot be redirected with this power. Any qualities that applied to the original attack, such as from a gun with Accurate or Deadly, a shotgun with the Spray quality, or a bonus from a power such as Projectile, do not carry over into the new attack.

fields.exceptional: Your redirected attack does 1 additional point of damage of its type. This effect replaces any exceptional success bonus the original attack against you would have done.

content.value: You may also redirect attacks that meet this powerâs criteria which fail against other individuals. If two Kineticism practitioners with the focus both seek to redirect the same attack, the one with the highest initiative order has the opportunity to do so first. If this still results in a tie and both parties wish to spend charges to redirect the attack, then both parties spend their charges, and the forces cancel; the attack is not redirected. You also may redirect your own failed attacks against a specific target or a different one, subject to the above rules for redirection.Â

With this power, your kinetic abilities and physical strength are united, crushing your foes with terrible strength. You can discharge your accumulated energies in a powerful blow, punishing those who stand before you.

Whenever you succeed in a Melee or Brawl attack against a target, for each point of damage you would inflict (determined before damage reduction), you may spend 1 charge of Kineticism. For each charge you spend, one of the points of damage becomes unsoakable and cannot be reduced or negated. If your attack does both normal and aggravated damage, you may apply this to the aggravated damage first.

In addition, you may gain a charge of Kineticism whenever you achieve an exceptional success against someone in an unarmed or melee attack. If you do, you may not spend those charges to activate Vengeful Strike on the same attack, but you may spend other charges that you have. You may not use this power in conjunction with combat maneuvers or other powers such as Fearful Blow or Earthshock. However, you may use this with powers that enhance your range, such as Flick or Kinetic Wave.
You may gain two charges whenever you achieve an exceptional success against someone in an unarmed or melee attack.

You have begun to learn the fundamentals of Kineticism and with it have gained an understanding that, through the power of the blood, energy and motion are interchangeable. With a momentâs concentration, you can focus your energies into an accumulated kinetic charge, which you can then channel into a flurry of movement.

You have the power to accumulate kinetic energy to discharge it later in a burst of speed. Spend a simple action to accumulate 1 charge of Kineticism. Whenever you spend a simple action for Movement, you can also spend a charge. If you do, you may take an additional 3 steps. You may only spend one charge per simple action spent on movement.

Whenever you expend a charge using this power, you may use all of your steps to briefly run up or along walls. However, to avoid falling you must end your movement on a horizontal surface. If the nature of the surface allows for it, your storyteller may allow a static Athletics challenge to remain in place or climb on subsequent actions.Â

An Ahrimane with this level of expertise fully understands the spiritual limitations and capabilities of her own vampiric vessel and her companionâs spiritual form. You can now join in symbiosis with your Beast Spirit, gaining both the benefits of a corporeal and spiritual entity. You can also traverse the Gauntlet and travel in the Umbra for a limited time, hunting your prey no matter where it flees.

Spend a Blood and a standard action to wholly bond with your Beast Spirit. Your physical form merges with the Beast Spirit into a singular spiritual entity. Thereafter, you appear as an anthropomorphic version of your Beast Spirit and you have a faint glowing aura displaying your spiritual symbiosis. While in this form you gain 3 Healthy wound levels, the benefits of any Animal Retainer qualities your Beast Spirit possesses, and the Attribute focus it possesses. You may continue to spend your blood to power your disciplines and techniques. While bonded with your Beast Spirit you are still considered a vampire (and not a spirit or animal), but you only take normal damage from sunlight.

In addition, while bonded with your Beast Spirit you may spend 5 full turns in chant and spend one of your Beast Spiritâs Gnosis to cross the Gauntlet travelling into or out of the Umbra. This power can only be maintained for one hour. When the power ends the vampire is ejected into the physical world and the Beast Spirit coalesces back into the umbra.
Focus [Charisma]:
You can spend the Gnosis of your Beast Spirit to fuel any of your disciplines instead of spending blood, subject to your normal limit per turn.

Spiritwalker is a major transformative power and cannot be combined with other transformative powers. However, you may combine it with Mantle with Altria as an exception to the rules governing major transformations. You may end this transformation at any time by spending a simple action.

With but a moment of concentration, you can shift the composition of your eyes to more greatly resemble those of an animal. Your ability to see in darkness increases, but this refraction also gives your eyes an eerie, animalistic glow.

Spend 1 Blood and use a simple action to activate Eyes of the Beast. For the next hour, your eyes glow a soft, feral red. While this effect lasts, you can see perfectly even in pitch darkness. So long as your character is not physically blinded, you can ï¬ght in darkness without needing the Fighting Blind combat maneuver.

Your Eyes of the Beast are always active, and you do not need to spend Blood to activate this power. Unlike the standard activation of this power, your eyes do not glow unless you choose to make them glow. Causing your eyes to glow, or to stop glowing, requires the expenditure of a simple action.

fields.title: The Path of Grief

content.value: âGrief is a weapon and a tool.Â  With this act, I am allowing you to decide.â â
Jacob Elghinn, clan Giovanni

Having taken note of the advances over the past decades in the Thaumaturgical arts, the Giovanni have likewise spentÂ  yearsÂ  seeking to expand the powers of Necromancy to embrace modern science and technology.Â  Based on the model of grief studies pioneered by Elisabeth KÃ¼bler-Ross, The Path of Grief draws on the psycheâs connection to death and uses necromantic energies to bring those emotions to the surface. Just as the departure of a family member can elicit a variety of reactions from sadness to relief to anger, so too can grief serve as a gateway to a variety of complex responses.

Immensely popular with Giovanni advisors and negotiators who use The Path of Grief to their advantage in business and social settings, this path invokes the fear of death in a variety of ways, from mild distress to crushing depression.Â  A person affected by this power finds these feelings to be overwhelming to such an extent that they cannot help but exhibit outward signs. While the character retains their agency with regard to the specifics of their behavior, their motivations become greatly skewed and their resulting actions should adhere to the templates described below.

fields.testPool: Social attribute + Occult skill versus targetâs Social attribute + Willpower.

fields.title: Kineticism

content.value: âJust because we are monsters does not mean we must act monstrously.â
â Elias Stone, Caitiff

The study of physics teaches that motion and energy are transmutable; the application of force over a distance. While the gifts of Caine enable vampires to move fast, hit hard, and absorb damage, the Caitiff have been gifted with the ability to absorb and channel kinetic energy into these activities through their own unique discipline. Kineticism draws power from motion and force, storing it to augment the abilities of its practitioner. Caitiff use Kineticism to achieve a variety of physical feats beyond what most clans are capable of.

As a discipline, Kineticism is something of a paradox: a proprietary tool for a âclanâ which is clanless, somehow learned but not exactly taught. Its advent is relatively recent, with no confirmed accounts of its use older than 25 to 30 years. Its use today is still relatively uncommon, and most vampires have no knowledge of the discipline or its applications. To those who do not condescend to associate with the clanless, it is mere superstition; the fabric of excuses spun by inept Scourges who failed to apprehend their quarry. Regardless of sect, the few elders who have witnessed Kineticism view it with fear and jealousy, its users aberrant and unpredictable. As such, they often seek to bind its practitioners into useful service or see them quietly eliminated.

To the Caitiff, Kineticism is both a useful tool and a sign of their legitimacy. It offers some means of defense against Camarilla Scourges and those who regard them as thin-blooded pushovers. It also validates their position as legitimate heirs to the curse of Caine. Many of the clanless assert that because the vampire clans give respect and consideration to the bloodlines who have their own disciplines, surely the Caitiff are due the same consideration. Others argue that Kineticism is sent from Caine himself as a gift to aid his blameless children whom he has freed from his curse.
Learning Kineticism
: This discipline may only be learned by Caitiff who take the Caitiff merit Inceptor (see
VTM Volume 2 Issue 1, page 46

). However, as an exception to the rule which limits purchasing that merit to character creation only, Caitiff may purchase the Inceptor merit for Kineticism if they spend sufficient time with a Kineticism practitioner. The amount of time and the level of interaction necessary is at the Storytellerâs discretion, typically a Complex Quest (see
VTM: Volume 2 Issue 1, page 98)

. Finding and observing its effects once may be sufficient for some Caitiff, while others might only learn the power from drinking the blood or sharing Vaulderie from an established practitioner. Indeed, many Caitiff and Panders claim (with varying levels of credibility) that Joseph Pander or the Stoneman himself âhooked them upâ.Â
Caitiff who wish to purchase the Inceptor merit after character creation must pay the difference in the out-of-clan XP costs for the discipline that they are losing as in-clan discipline.Â
Kineticism cannot be learned through diablerie as part of the Sabbat setting rules on Diablerie. As Caitiff cannot teach disciplines, it is impossible for a non-Caitiff to possess Kineticism.
Kineticism and Charges

Kineticism involves accumulating kinetic energy during combat which becomes a charge. A practitioner of Kineticism accumulates and spends charges in a variety of ways. Kineticism charges do not last outside of combat. During combat there is no effective time limit; however, all charges will dissipate rapidly once combat ends. Even with careful preparation or the engineering of effects intended to build charges, the fleeting nature of these energies make it impossible to enter combat with more than a single stored charge.Â

The practice of accumulating and holding a charge of Kineticism is always overt. Onlookers will notice the practitioner briefly vibrate or oscillate. Thereafter, her form will flicker with intermittent crackles that are clearly supernatural, increasing as more charges accumulate. As a result, a Kineticism practitioner cannot benefit from supernatural concealment such as Unseen Presence while she has at least one stored charge but may still use other effects which do not hide her presence such as Conceal or Mask of 100 Faces. These effects do not disguise the manifestations of stored charges. Anyone who has knowledge of this power and possesses the skill Science: Physics or who possesses at least one level of Kineticism will be able to determine how many charges a practitioner is holding based on her appearance. This observation does not require an action.
Maximum Number of Charges

Upon being taught her first level of Kineticism, a practitioner can store up to one charge. A kineticist can hold a total number of charges equal to her total levels in Kineticism and number of Kineticism techniques.
Kineticism and Celerity:
Kineticism can be used during Celerity rounds.

fields.testPool: The Kineticism wielder uses her Physical attribute + Athletics skill versus targetâs Physical attribute + Dodge skill.

content.value: As a skilled necromancer you can manipulate the energy found in a wraith to alter mundane objects within the waking world. Once bound within its new prison, the wraith has no choice but to perform the desired function. With this ability, you can punish or award wraiths while using their innate energy to further your own agenda.

Once you have learned this power you can create Deathly Devices, imprisoning the soul of a wraith into a piece of equipment. Spend 1 point of Blood and your standard action as you target a nearby wraith. If you succeed in an opposed challenge, the wraith becomes bound to the object as its corpus is absorbed. Only Stock NPCs of level 4 or lower can be bound within a Deathly Device. The Storyteller may also rule that this power does not work on specific wraiths of her choosing.
Choose one of the following effects:
Powered

: Wraiths bound to this item imbue it with their own ghostly energy, bringing it to life without any external force. The item does not require batteries, gasoline, electricity, or any other source of power to function. The wraiths energy can power small devices like remote controlled cars or music boxes, or large devices such as windmills or vehicles.
Dysfunctional

: Wraiths bound to this item squeeze into the crevices, causing it to malfunction and stutter to an inexplicable stop. For the duration of the wraiths binding, the device will not function. Computers will not turn on, cars will not start, and pacemakers will shut down.
Conscription

: Wraiths bound to this item must seek to fulfill set orders before she can gain her freedom. While the wraith can control the object and act independently, it may act in ways that would compromise the item in order to fulfill the instructions. For example, a wraith bound to a gun and commanded to shoot a specific vampire will attempt to do so when the opportunity arises â whether the user wants it to or not. Once she does, she is released. The Storyteller will determine how any wraiths bound in this manner behave.
Enduring

: The item is magically enhanced by the wraith making it more difficult to destroy. As a result, the item can only be destroyed by supernaturally means â magical items or characters using an appropriate Discipline.
Symbiote

: The item is magically enhanced by a wraith who is familiar with its usage. The item grants a +1 bonus to your test pool when used for its intended purpose. This bonus cannot be used during combat. For example, a set of lock-picks gives you a +1 bonus when using the Security skill to pick a lock, but a sword that imprisons a wraith does not grant any Melee skill bonus.

Unless you have the focus, you may only create a total number of Deathly Devices equal to your rating in this Path (so a maximum of 5). Creating new devices beyond this will free the wraith contained in the oldest one. You may use Deathly Devices created either by you or by another necromancer with this Path. If someone without the Deathly Device powerÂ  attempts to use a Deathly Device, they do not receive any benefits conveyed by Path of Soul Bonding.
Focus [Charisma]:
You may create a total number of Deathly Devices up to twice your number of dots in this path, to a maximum of 10.

âWhat separates us from the Ventrue and Lasombra? I'd be happy to explain. While the Ventrue were born to rule and the Lasombra rule the born, we Giovanni lord over the dead and there are far more dead than either could ever rule combined
Enzo Giovanni

For centuries, improving their skills and mastering the arts of the dead drove the more magically minded of the Giovanni family. Over time, they came to understand that, if manipulated properly, wraiths are more than just tortured souls; they are sources of nearly unlimited knowledge and power. Of course, this knowledge was fiercely guarded and taught only to the most talented of necromancers. With the knowledge found in the Path of Soul Bonding, you have learned how to manipulate and utilize wraiths, drawing on them to power Necromantic rituals, to gain knowledge, and even to alter weapons and other objects.
Dark Vessels and Deathly Devices:
The Path of Soul Bonding allows a Necromancer to create
Dark Vessels
and
Deathly Devices

. Dark Vessels are small, fist-sized trinkets or jewelry (non-equipment items) that contain the trapped soul of a wraith. With a simple action a Dark Vessel can be broken to release a variety of effects as described below. Deathly Devices are pieces of equipment, armor, or weapons that are augmented by the trapped soul of a wraith. The augmentations a necromancer can utilize are described below. In addition, and as explained below, there are a number of base characteristics that are always true of Dark Vessels and Deathly Devices.

Although the wraith is trapped when placed in a Dark Vessel or Deathly Device, her presence still permeates the area 1 step around the item. Characters unfamiliar with Necromancy often feel unease and dread when within 1 step of the Dark Vessel or Deadly Device or when touching it. Characters who possess the Medium merit can hear the wraith in her captivity, often wailing, asking for mercy, or trying to negotiate freedom. Most necromancers elect to store their Dark Vessels in a safe location until they are needed, although more than one has surreptitiously given a Dark Vessel to an unwitting victim in hopes that it will drive them mad.

Bound wraiths can sense the immediate surroundings of the object they occupy but cannot communicate with the mundane world. They may not use any skills or powers unless freed. These bindings persist for 6 months, minus the Stock NPC or Retainer level of the wraith. You may elect to renew the binding by spending the Blood cost once more. Renewing the effect in this manner does not require possession of the item. If the binding is allowed to naturally fade, you must begin the process anew by gaining control of a wraith and having the item in question in your possession. Necromancers who possess at least 1 dot in this Path can safely release a bound wraith by spending a simple action. While bound to a Dark Vessel or Deathly Device the wraith is considered a controlled wraith for the purposes of the Sepulchre Path power Summon Soul. Because the wraith is already bound to a Dark Vessel or Deathly Device, the wraith cannot be bound to a different location with the Sepulchre Path power Bind Soul. Unless explicitly stated, other powers or rituals such as Spirit Beacon that affect wraiths do not affect wraiths bound to Dark Vessels or Deathly devices.Â

When a wraith is released, it is immediately returned to the Shadowlands. Wraiths who are not generously compensated for their time and emotional energy tend to hold a grudge against the necromancer who bound them. If the object housing the wraith is destroyed, the wraith immediately enters a Harrowing.

Wraiths are creatures of pure entropic energy; entities that exist trapped in the Shadowlands.  A talented necromancer can harness this energy to power blood magic and wreak havoc in the living world.  With this power, you manipulate the energy of wraiths, binding them into objects to store for future use.
The Harrowing
A wraith finds herself sucked into a
Harrowing
whenever she loses all her
corpus

(health levels), has a fetter destroyed, or is sacrificed to fuel a Necromantic ritual. A Harrowing is an intense battle deep within the psyche of the wraith that forces her to relive important moments of her time among the breathing. This might be an act of defiance or forgiveness in the face of cruelty, an act of heroism to prevent a devastating loss, or anything else of significant emotional impact to the wraith in her mortal days. The exact details of the Harrowing differ from wraith to wraith, but it is always an emotionally excruciating and exhausting experience.Â

Each Harrowing has a task that the wraith must first discover and then attempt to complete, though this path is typically obscured. For example, a Harrowing may show a scene with a robber poised to harm a parent while the wraith looks on in fear as a reflection of her mortal child self. A firearm in the wraithâs hand gives her an easy solution to the problem â kill the robber before they can harm the parent; or she can attempt to stop the robber without violence and end the cycle of loss and pain. Success or failure is based entirely on the individual wraithâs history and the lesson found within the Harrowing.

Once the wraith has completed the task set out in her Harrowing â be that to succeed or not â she is ejected near one of her fetters with 1 Pathos and 1 Corpus. A wraithâs Harrowing lasts at least one month; however, they can be much longer than that based on the severity of the situation. Should a wraith fail too many Harrowings, she will find herself sucked into Oblivion and transformed into a Spectre.
Gathering Wraiths

Players will undeniably want to have steady access to wraiths to maximize their use of this power. To spare Storytellers the difficulty of running scenes where characters go hunting to replenish their supplies of Dark Vessels and Deathly Devices, practitioners of this Path may obtain a single wraith by spending a downtime action. These wraiths are 2-point Stock NPCs of no special significance and with no discipline specializations. When the player arrives at the game, the Storyteller will make her an item card.Â

If the PC wants to find a wraith with somewhat uncommon characteristics, such as one who speaks Romanian or who has a certain non-discipline specialization, when the player arrives at the game she may engage in a simple test with the Storyteller. If the player wins or ties, she can find the desired quality in a wraith. If not, she obtains a standard 2-point Stock NPC wraith.

If the PC wants a more powerful wraith or one with a rare characteristic, such as one who speaks Old French, has a specific discipline specialization, or who died in an overly specific way, the Storyteller may employ the quest system.

âWater holds many secrets. Waves and currents ensure that such thingsÂ  remain hidden. I suggest you reconsider your position and alter course, else you too many be lost at sea like so many before you.âÂ
â Judson Hare, Tremere

Water is a fundamental component of life. For most creatures, water ranks as one of their greatest needs, second only to air. For humanity, access to water has shaped the growth of civilizations, carried the ships of war, and served as a barrier to distant and mysterious shores. It is no wonder that ancient miracle workers and modern thaumaturges alike have sought to exert mastery over water, harnessing its power for a variety of effects.

Many thaumaturge historians have argued over the origin of this ancient path. The Followers of Set claim that magicians of the pharaohs used the mystical properties of the blood and the power of the Nile to fertilize the lands of Kemet long before the burning of the Alexandrian Library. Greek historians claim that this power originated from the tributaries of the River Styx. Even more ancient Mesopotamian scholars claim this power was even older, originating from the banks of the Tigris and Euphrates in the Fertile Crescent. Whatever its origins, during the Age of Discovery thaumaturgists popularized it, renaming it after the ancient Roman god of the Oceans. It is said that this path was particularly popular amongst the great powers seeking to conquer the New World. It is no secret, however, that the Sorcerers among the Setites and Assamites blanch just a little when they hear the modern name of this particular path.
Neptuneâs Might and Successive Applications

: The powers of this path are like the sea as the storm rises â slow at first, but substantial at its peak. As such, successive applications of the same power to a target will cause either a new effect or cumulative effects. If an effect is titled âCumulative Applicationâ it stacks with the effects of the prior or subsequent use of the power on the same target.Â  If the word âcumulativeâ is not in the title, the effects do not stack; instead, the effects of the new application apply.Â  The effects of successive applications apply regardless of whether you or a different practitioner select the same target who is already under the effect of that same specific Neptuneâs Might power. However, successive and cumulative effects do not last indefinitely; after 10 minutes have passed since the last application, any successive uses are once again considered a first application. Choosing to end a powerâs effects prematurely does not reset the application counter but instead begins the 10-minute period.Â

Example: Tacy the Tremere targets Brittnie the Brujah for the first time that night with Prison of Water. Tacy is successful and Brittnie suffers the effects of the first application of the power. While Brittnie is suffering the effects of the first application of Prison of Water, Tyrone the Tremere successfully targets Brittnie with Prison of Water and, because the effects of this power are successive and not cumulative, Brtitnie now suffers only the effects of the second application of the power.Â  Tacy and Tyrone then leave the area.Â  Thirty minutes later, Brittnie encounters Tacy again, and once more Tacy successfully targets Brittnie with Prison of Water.Â  Because so much time has passed since Brittnie was last under the effects of an application of the power, she now suffers only the effects of the first application of Prison of Water.

Wraiths are creatures of pure entropic energy; entities that exist trapped in the Shadowlands. A talented necromancer can harness this energy to power blood magic and wreak havoc in the living world. With this power, you manipulate the energy of wraiths, binding them into objects to store for future use.

Once you have learned this power you may create Dark Vessels by imprisoning the soul of a wraith into a small trinket or object approximately the size of a fist. Spend 1 point of Blood and your standard action as you target a nearby wraith of Stock NPC level 4 or lower. If you succeed in an opposed challenge, the wraith becomes bound to the object as its corpus is absorbed. Only Stock NPCs level 4 or lower can be bound within a Dark Vessel. If a wraithâs Stock NPC level somehow increases beyond level 4 while the wraith is bound within a Dark Vessel, the wraith is immediately released and the Dark Vessel is rendered inert. The Storyteller may also rule that this power does not work on specific wraiths of her choosing.
For the power to function normally, the object must be breakable. If it cannot be broken with a simple action, the wraith will remain bound, but other functions of this power cannot be used.Â
By spending a simple action, you may break a single Dark Vessel and send the Wraith inside to a Harrowing while gaining one of the following effects:Â
Dark Offering: By consuming a vessel, you can use the last of its life force to settle the ravages of your Beast before sending its inhabitant to the beyond, removing one of your Beast traits.

Mnemosyneâs Grasp: You can access a wraithâs memories, briefly gaining the ability to speak, read, and understand a single language she once spoke. This must be a language commonly spoken in the time and place where she lived or the place of her birth. This effect lasts for 1 hour.
Soul Food: You can destroy a vessel to extract the spiritual essence from a captive wraith, mystically transforming it into vitae. You gain 2 points of Blood which cannot exceed your maximum.

Wisdom of Death: A wraithâs spirit contains a lifetime of carefully cultivated skills and talents. You can take a portion of these energies to gain a +1 wild card bonus to a single skill of your choice for the next 10 minutes. You may only benefit from a single instance of this application at a time.

Unless you have the focus, you may only create a total number of Dark Vessels equal to your rating in this Path, (so a maximum of 5). Creating new vessels beyond your rating in this Path will free the wraith contained in the oldest one. You may use Dark Vessels created either by you or by another necromancer with this Path. If someone without the Dark Vessel power attempts to use a Dark Vessel, they do not receive any benefits conveyed by Path of Soul Bonding.
You may create a total number of Dark Vessels up to twice your number of dots in this Path, to a maximum of 10.

The Shadowlands lies superimposed over the real world like an echo of things long past. Buildings that have been torn down are still standing; carriages rush past on ghostly streets; walls, furniture, and even forested areas still exist where the modern world shows no sign of their presence. Through the use of Shroud Sight, you can see into the Shadowlands as easily as looking at the present world.

Once purchased, this power is always active. You can see and sense the Shadowlands around you, perceiving the echoes of the past that still linger in that other world. You can notice wraiths in the Shadowlands, but you are granted no special ability to communicate with them. If a wraith speaks a language you know, then you can have discourse with it.

You can spend a standard action to study a living mortal and determine whether it is likely she will become a wraith. Wraiths are created when people die with unfulï¬ lled issues, particularly strong emotional connections or other deep ties. You can also look at an item in the physical world and ascertain if it is a wraith fetter: an object of great importance to a particular wraith, which can be used to call or bind it.

Deep within the Shadowlands, powerful tempests and storms ravage the sepia-toned landscape, ranging from rains of plasm to lightning-ï¬ashes of soulï¬re. You can unleash this fell power, hurling a lance of pure oblivion toward your enemies.

Spend 1 Blood and use a standard action to hurl a bolt of plasm from the tempests of the Shadowlands. Make an opposed challenge using your Social attribute + Occult versus the targetâs Physical attribute + Dodge. If successful, this attack deals 3 points of normal damage, and it can strike individuals in the Shadowlands â including wraiths, physical travelers, and individuals whose souls have been stolen â as well as those on the physical plane.
Your Stygian Lance deals 4 points of normal damage, instead of 3.
Damage from your Stygian Lance cannot be reduced or negated, but can be healed normally.

fields.title: Accept Deathâs Embrace

content.value: For every living and unliving being, death is an inevitable truth. As the final stage of grief, acceptance is the realization of that truth â a state of release where the psyche is freed from the ego and prepares itself for what lies beyond. Some have described this state of mind as immensely liberating; a blissful window of clarity wherein they were finally able to find themselves.

Spend a point of Blood and your standard action as you inform your target of her imminent demise. You must have your targetâs Gaze and Focus to use this power. If you succeed in an opposed challenge, for the next 10 minutes your targetâs psyche is overcome with the certainty that her life is about to end and must choose the circumstances as to how she will perish. She must select from one of the following restrictions and inform the Storyteller privately of her choice (inform her she should not tell you which restriction she has chosen). Should she be attacked or become threatened, the chosen restriction will apply.
Desperate Escape

: The target will seek to escape as a means of prolonging her life. Until she either dies or escapes all pursuers, she must devote every action to fleeing the scene or taking actions in support of that effort, including evading her pursuers. She may only initiate opposed challenges to facilitate her escape, such as the use of Mesmerism to order a guard out of her way. In the event escape is physically impossible, she may choose to fight until another option presents itself.
Last Stand

: The target seeks a valiant demise, choosing to confront death head on. Until her attackers are either all dead or have fled, she may not attempt to withdraw or flee. She must spend every action attempting to incapacitate her attackers and, if they are within sight but not within her range to attack, she must move toward them. She may still maneuver to obtain a more advantageous position, making use of cover or choke points, activate combat powers, or calling for help. Should her attackers surrender or flee, she is not obliged to pursue them. Once all attackers are incapacitated, have surrendered, or are no longer visible, she may act normally.
Stoic Resolve

: The target embraces her end with dignity, choosing to offer a token resistance. She may fight or flee as she prefers, but she may not spend Blood to heal, will not accept the Assist Defender combat maneuver or call for help, and cannot consent to the use of powers by allies to aid her.

While the player may choose freely, this is not a conscious choice for her character. Therefore, she cannot be coerced into a specific option through the use of Dominate or other powers. However, once she has chosen, she will immediately suspect her life is at risk. She will know what her restriction is, and may act in advance of being directly threatened to preserve her life.

A character under the effects of this power may not relent to powers which might compel her to act against her restriction, such as Dominate or Dread Gaze, but she is affected by them normally. In the event of a stalemate, such as if the target wishes to fight but her opponents remain out of reach and visible, she is not obliged to take any action and can act freely until circumstances change.Â

fields.exceptional: You may eliminate one of the three options as a choice for your target. She may only choose from the remaining two options.

content.value: The Storyteller will inform you which of the options your target has chosen. You may inquire discreetly through the Storyteller so that your target does not know that you are aware of her choice.

fields.testPool: Social attribute + Occult skill versus targetâs Social attribute + Willpower.

fields.title: Harvest Despair

content.value: The depression that follows grief brings with it a sense of futility and
despair

. In this state, the mind expends energy yet accomplishes nothing, sabotaged by its own efforts. With this power, you can harvest this energy, turning it into useful sustenance. A number of Giovanni have come to appreciate the vitae created through this magic, noting its flavorful salty notes.

Spend 1 point of Blood and a simple action to activate this power. For the next 10 minutes, whenever you are involved in an opposed challenge against a visible target, you may announce the use of Harvest Despair before any tests are thrown. If you do, you receive a -5 penalty to your test pool for the challenge. However, if you win despite the penalty your opponent feels a sense of futility and despair as she is assailed by entropic forces. She loses a point of Willpower and up to 2 points of Blood, both of which you may absorb to restore any of your own spent points. If your target is not a vampire, she instead loses the type of fuel appropriate to her creature type (such as Gnosis for werewolves or Glamour for changelings) , which you absorb as blood. If instead your target has no Willpower to lose or if sheâs a Stock NPC without Willpower, she must immediately cease attacking you, and cannot do so again until this powerâs duration is over. You may only benefit from this power once per turn, but you may announce its use during Celerity rounds if you have already activated it. If you use this power but fail in the challenge, you may still use it again on subsequent challenges in the same turn until you succeed.

You may only benefit from this power when used against a target who wishes you genuine harm. It will not work if you activate it and then invite allies or otherwise friendly people to hit you, nor will the power function in contrived scenarios. The blood generated from this power is considered inert and does not create a blood bond. This power is not considered hostile for the purposes of powers such as Entrancement or Majesty.
By activating this power you take a -3 penalty instead of a -5 penalty.

fields.testPool: Social attribute + Occult skill versus targetâs Social attribute + Willpower.

fields.title: Compellling Offer

content.value: The bargaining stage is the psycheâs attempt to cope with mortality and grief â the product of realization giving way to desperation. Individuals in this state are immensely pliable, eager to explore any option to avert catastrophe. With this power, your target gains a sense of mortal anxiety that becomes a state of mind that you can exploit to your advantage.

This power allows you to make an offer which weighs on your targetâs mind until she makes a decision. Spend 1 point of Blood and three or more standard actions as you make an offer to your target. You must have your targetâs Gaze and Focus to use this power, and you must be able to communicate with her (telepathically is fine). Thereafter, the choice presented lingers in the target's mind, always at the edge of her thinking.

Once the offer is made and until your target makes her choice, she may not take any antagonistic action toward you, which includes targeting you with hostile powers or attacking you. She may, however, seek to negotiate. You may act against her normally during this time, and she must continue to consider the offer. If you withdraw the offer by spending a simple action, this powerâs effects end.
The target may exercise one of the following options at any time:
Reject the Offer
: Your target may spend 2 points of Willpower at any time to reject the offer. The power ends and she may act normally without restriction from this power.
Accept the Offer

: Your target can accept either the initial offer or the negotiated terms of one mutually agreed upon. Once accepted, she remains unable to take hostile action toward you until the end of the night or until the terms are fulfilled, whichever comes first. If you take hostile action against the target or if you fail to uphold the arrangement, the effects of the power end. The target cannot violate the agreement without spending 2 points of Willpower. If she does, the effects of the power end.

Offers may not be designed to be life threatening to your target. You are free to describe an offer in shorter or longer terms, making an offer that either ends sooner than the end of the night, or a more open offer that would seemingly last beyond the current night. However, when the offer expires or the night ends (whichever is first), the effects of this power fade.

A target may only be affected by a single use of this power per night. Any additional use of this power from you or from anyone else upon the same target will fail. You may not use this power on friendly targets purely with the intent of triggering this limitation; the Storyteller may intervene in instances where she believes this is the case.

You may only have a single active offer at a given time. Any additional offers end the effects of the current one. This power does not work if the offer is farcical or clearly intended to insult or ridicule, the determination of which is subject to the Storytellerâs discretion. This includes offers involving vulgarity or demeaning acts.

You may instead have a number of active offers equal to your dots in Occult plus one. Any additional offers require you to choose an active offer to end. When using Compelling Offer, you may make the same offer to multiple parties at once, provided you have each targetâs Gaze and Focus and can communicate with them. These targets count individually toward your maximum number of active offers.

Example: 
In the early evening, Mariella arrives in a small town that a roving group of Anarchs is occupying. Their presence is making work difficult at the local quarry that provides materials to a variety of her construction projects. She wants to convince them to leave.Â

She finds the bar where the Baron spends her time. Outside, she sees a pair of rough looking thugs. She chats them up and decides to offer them a deal: they should leave the gang and come and work for her. She uses Compelling Offer and has the Charisma focus, allowing her to affect both thugs. The two say they will think it over.Â  She enters the bar and engages in negotiations with the Baron. Mariella offers her $50,000 if she and her gang will leave town that night and uses Compelling Offer once again. She tells the Baron if she does not accept, her next offer wonât be so nice. The Baron is angered and spends 2 points of Willpower to reject the offer. She stands and yells for her thugs to grab Mariella. The thugs enter; however, they cannot attack Mariella as her earlier offer lingers in their minds. The Baron is incensed but does not want to fight Mariella one on one. Mariella smiles and tells the thugs to leave. To the Baronâs surprise, they oblige.

fields.testPool: Social attribute + Occult skill versus targetâs Social attribute + Willpower.

fields.title: Lash Out

content.value: The second stage of grief is
anger

; the most primordial response to the danger of external threats. The surge of adrenaline it provides helps the body defend itself from attackers and bends the psyche toward aggression. In other circumstances, rage is a hindrance, causing one to lash out in the absence of an actual threat and alienating oneself from others. With respect to grief, anger has a masking effect, used to protect the psyche from feelings of vulnerability and sadness that it lacks the strength to process.

Spend 1 point of Blood and your standard action as you make a remark to your target about her mortality. For example, you may say âYour temperâs going to get you into trouble someday,â âYour rashness will be the death of you,â or simply âMemento Moriâ if you have a flare for the dramatic. You must have your targetâs gaze and focus to use this power. For the next hour, your target is susceptible to rage frenzy as if she had 3 Beast traits more than her current total. Therefore, even if she has zero Beast Traits, she is susceptible to additional triggers for frenzy, including the need to test for frenzy if she takes 2 points of damage from a single source (see
MET VTM, Chapter Seven: Dramatic Systems, page 301

). This penalty only applies to determining frenzy; it is not applied to determine if degeneration occurs. This penalty is cumulative with other modifiers that give a penalty to Beast traits, such as the Brujah clan weakness and the Short Fuse flaw.

In addition, if your target is on the receiving end of any action which could be construed as moderately disrespectful, she must spend a point of Willpower or immediately act out in a noticeable fashion. Appropriate actions include attacking, yelling, breaking something, or storming out. If she spends a point of Willpower, she may ignore the source of disrespect and all other similar affronts for 5 minutes.

This power affects supernatural creatures and non-vampires equally. Werewolves are considered to have 3 additional levels of rage for determining frenzy. Even if your target does not have a Beast, she will enter a mental state identical in all ways to a vampireâs rage frenzy, attacking the source of her rage.

fields.exceptional: Your target must test for rage frenzy as if she had 4 additional Beast traits; therefore, she must test whenever she takes a single point of damage.

content.value: You may target up to 3 individuals with this power if you have their Gaze and Focus. Should you expend a point of Willpower to retest any of these opposed challenges, you also gain that retest for the remainder of the opposed challenges without spending further Willpower. If you spend the Willpower to retest after some challenges are already resolved, you cannot go back to previous challenges you lost to apply that Willpower retest retroactively.

fields.testPool: Social attribute + Occult skill versus targetâs Social attribute + Willpower.

fields.title: Deny Deathâs Imminence

content.value: Denial is a common first-stage response to grief, where the terminal or bereaved actively rejects the reality of her circumstances. This early coping mechanism is theorized to exist, in part, to allow the psyche to accumulate the emotional energy needed to face the crisis. You have the power to induce this state, bewildering your victims.

Spend a point of Blood and your simple action to project necrotic energies, extending 15 steps from you in every direction. Those within this area lose the ability to comprehend and process mortal threats and instead resort to denial. Supernatural creatures can sense this effect and are immune; however, most ordinary humans cannot resist this power. As a result, Stock NPCs of rating 3 or lower will ignore any threats to their well being provided they and others are not directly harmed, continuing to act as if nothing is happening. If they are attacked, they will react fearfully. For example, if a Tzimisce in Horrid Form lumbers past an affected Stock 3 NPC while this power is active, the NPC will be unable to process the imminent threat and will ignore it entirely. This power has no effect on Stock NPCs rated 4 or higher.

The use of this power can effectively preserve the Masquerade as bystanders will ignore acts of violence and other Masquerade breeching effects carried out in their presence. These observers will mentally classify the events as non-remarkable, even if they might otherwise regard them as extraordinary. They will not act on these events and will quickly forget any details over the span of 24 hours as their recollection blurs.
This power affects Stock NPCs of rating 5 or lower.

fields.testPool: Social attribute + Occult skill versus targetâs Social attribute + Willpower.

content.value: To live as a vampire is to deny oneâs mortality, holding onto life by drinking the blood of the living. By wrapping yourself in energies from the Shadowlands, you transcend the vampiric state and fully embrace the inevitability of death and the power it brings. To confront you is to oppose mortality itself, a terrifying ordeal even for the so-called Undead. This transformation is a dramatic one as you emerge as an unrelenting force of entropy that is devoid of life.

Spend 1 Blood and a simple action to channel necromantic energies throughout your body, flooding you with the power of entropy and transforming you into an unmistakable yet undeniably powerful figure of perfect death.

In this form, the finality and single-mindedness of death drives your actions and purpose making you much harder to control or influence. You may substitute your Physical attribute for your Mental or Social attribute when defending against Mental or Social challenges. You also have the ability to stoke the necrotic energies to restore your form. Whenever you spend a point of Willpower to retest a challenge, you may immediately heal up to 3 health levels, normal or aggravated. This ability does not require an action to activate and can be activated during Celerity rounds and outside of your turn in the initiative order. You must spend Willpower to gain this benefit; abilities that allow you to forego the actual spending of Willpower such as Clear Sighted or Iron Will cannot be used in conjunction with this ability.
Whenever you spend a point of Willpower to retest a challenge, you gain a +2 bonus to your trait pool for that retest attempt.
This power is a major transformative power and cannot be combined with other major transformations.

There are five stages to the process of decomposition. The second stage, bloat, causes a corpse to fill with an accumulation of gases as the body continues to decay. By wielding dominion over death, you fill your body with necrotic gases causing you to bloat and swell. When struck by enemies, the wounds burst releasing the draining energies of decay in a disgusting eruption of foul-smelling air and ectoplasmic carnage.

Spend 1 Blood and a simple action to assume a bloated and decaying form, imbuing your innards with a pustulant mixture of blood and ash. Anyone within 2 steps of you who succeeds in a Brawl or Melee attack against you takes 2 points of normal damage as pus and gore sprays out of the resultant wound, showering them in viscera. The necrotic magics present in this secretion prevent the target from benefiting from supernatural concealment, such as Unseen Presence, until they have removed the viscera. Victims may spend a standard action hastily wiping off the ectoplasm to relieve themselves of its negative effects.Â

In addition, you may imbue a number of nearby zombies equal to your dots in the Occult skill that you control with a lesser effect that causes them to explode when they have lost all health levels. An exploding Zombie dealings 2 normal damage to all characters within 2 steps. This utterly destroys the zombieâs form, leaving rotted parts and scattered gore throughout the immediate area. Both you and any zombies you control are immune to the damage from this explosion. Treat any exploding zombies as individual sources of damage, such as when triggered by a bomb explosion or Firestorm.
Corpulent Discharge lasts for 15 minutes. You may only have a single application of this power active at a given time. This power counts as a minor transformation.
Anyone who hits you with a Brawl or Melee attack takes an additional point of normal damage for a total of 3 and your affected zombie allies explode for 3 points normal damage when destroyed.

Archetypal concepts of death and money are often intertwined, with deities such as Hades and Baron Samedi having jurisdiction over wealth in addition to the afterlife. To these figures, the souls of the departed are theirs to claim, pledged either through willful agreement or ancient laws. By leveraging these debts, you exert power over those who drift closer to death, assailing them with necrotic energies.Â

Spend a simple action to visibly point to your target as you make her mortality the subject of your attention. Thereafter, whenever she spends or loses a point of Willpower in your presence you gain a +1 wild card bonus in offensive challenges against her for each point of Willpower she has spent or lost over the next 10 minutes, up to a maximum of 5 points. In addition, she retains your Gaze and Focus throughout this period of time.

You may only have one designated target at a time. If you choose an additional target, any effects against your previous target fade and the count of how many times she spent Willpower in your presence resets.

In addition to the above benefit, if your target spends a point of Willpower for a retest in a challenge where you are the attacker or the defender, you may regain a single point of spent Willpower. You may only benefit from this effect once per turn.

The iconography of Death carrying a scythe is derived from the Greek god Chronos and Cronus, a lesser god of the harvest who carried a sickle used to cut grain. In mythology, Chronos eating his children was an allegory for time devouring all things. The scythe becomes an image that reminds us that death reaps the souls of the living like a farmer who harvests crops from the field. Manifesting your power over death, you call forth terrible necromantic energies and shape them into the visage of Deathâs most terrifying weapon.

Spend a Blood and a simple action to summon an ethereal scythe bathed in a cold blue flame. If you have access to it, you may use the Quick Draw combat maneuver to quickly produce the weapon instead of spending a simple action, but you must pay the cost to activate the maneuver. This weapon is an extension of your necromantic powers and cannot be given to another character nor enhanced by other powers such as Quietus. You may make a successful Melee attack with the weapon it does 1 point of aggravated damage. The weapon possesses the traits Deadly and Brutal. The scythe functions with any Potence powers you have.

Once created, this weapon cannot be broken even with elder levels of potence, nor removed from your hands with the Disarm combat maneuver, nor can it be handed to another character, picked up or used by anyone else. Once conjured, the scythe remains material for 1 hour.Â

The energy of your Scythe grows to a truly terrifying countenance, gaining the Reach weapon quality. In addition, as an icon of death it imbues a number of zombies under your control up to your dots in the Occult skill with necrotic energies allowing them to do aggravated damage with their unarmed Brawl attacks.Â

From the moment of death, vermin are attracted to a corpse. By expelling necromantic energies from your body, you beckon a thick black swarm of blowflies. These are quickly followed by flesh flies, dung beetles, and moths that surround you in a thick cloud of carrion insects hungry for dead flesh.

Spend 1 point of Blood and a simple action to summon a swarm of carrion insects that envelop you until the end of the next turn, obscuring you from your enemies and making it impossible for you to be targeted by a Firearms, Throwing Attacks, or power that requires Gaze and Focus. However, you may make ranged attacks and use Gaze and Focus powers normally. You may choose which types of insects you summon; practitioners with Egyptian ties are known to favor scarabs while South American practitioners often employ bot flies. When this power expires, the insects withdraw inside you and are consumed, healing you for 1 point of normal damage.
When you activate this power, you may extend its effects to a number of zombies under your control up to your dots in the Occult skill.

Wraiths have more knowledge than the living credit them with. They are more than just tools to be manipulated by necromancers â they are creatures with their own experiences and insight to draw from. You have mastered the art of forcing a wraith to break the limitations of earthly equipment. Your Deathly Devices are imbued with the entropic energies of the Underworld that allows them to function in unexplainable and twisted ways.

Once learned, Twisted Metal can be used to augment your Deathly Devices. Spend an additional point of Blood and a simple action to augment a Deathly Device. The item gains an additional item quality of your choice. The object must meet the requirements to bear that quality. For example, a one-handed sword may only gain melee weapon qualities appropriate to a one-handed weapon. This quality may exceed the objectâs maximum number of qualities but, as a reminder, you cannot benefit from the same quality twice.Â
Objects imbued in this way take on a noticeable twisted and abnormal appearance signifying its augmentation. You may determine its appearance, subject to Storyteller approval.
This power lasts indefinitely, but you may only have a single application of this power in operation at a time, with a new application replacing an old one.

The Deathly Device augmented by Twisted Metal can gain an additional item quality of any type even if it is not appropriate for the item. For example, a sword could gain Staking, or a claymore could gain Balanced. You could even imbue a ranged weapon with the Hardened Quality as the wraith inside supernaturally deflects incoming attacks.

fields.title: Serpentis

content.value: âThe Serpent was in the garden ï¬rst, you know.â â Hesha Ruhadze

In ancient Egyptian temples and sleek, modern sky rises, the clan of serpents practices its arts and worships its founder: the vampiric god, Set. Setites consider the Serpentis discipline to be a gift of Setâs benevolence, and they treat its practice with reverence, praising Set with each use and invocation of these powers.

fields.testPool: The Serpentis wielder uses her Social attribute + Subterfuge versus the targetâs Social attribute + Willpower.

fields.title: Protean

content.value: âTo hunt, to soar, to fear neither man nor beast. This is what it means to be a vampire.â â Beckett, Noddist Scholar

For hundreds of years, vampires clung to the shelter of cities, hiding themselves among mortal man. The wilderness was too untamed for all but the most savage and the most hardy. The Protean discipline, developed ï¬rst among the Gangrel, allowed a vampire to ï¬nd shelter in the soil of the earth, or to travel as swiftly as a bat could ï¬ y or a wolf could run. Protean was essential to vampiric survival in the Middle Ages, and even in modern nights, it remains one of the most cinematic and renowned disciplines of the children of Caine.

fields.testPool: There is no standardized Protean test pool.

fields.title: Spiritus

content.value: âThis place is open to all who come seeking a higher path. But I know your heart and your intentions. You will leave, quickly, or my companions and I will teach you a lesson on ignorance.â
Muricia, Gangrel Ahrimane

Wielding enigmatic and secret shamanistic magics, Ahrimanes transcend the limitations of their thaumaturgical powers, giving them a greater connection and control over the world of spirits. As an Ahrimane learns Spiritus, she can not only interact with the spirit world, but she can harness its power to aid her own physical form. The most powerful practitioners of Spiritus are said to have been able to use spirits as conduits to cross fully into the realm the werewolves referred to as the Umbra.Â

While the shamanistic practices of Spiritus do not grant an Ahrimane direct knowledge of spirits or the realms they inhabit, it does allow them to undergo a spiritual awakening that bestows the practitioner with an awareness of the umbral realms. As a practitioner advances in her mastery of Spiritus she becomes unable to view her surroundings in quite the same way. As she becomes enlightened to other worlds and spiritual creatures, an Ahrimane feels burdened by how the mundane world appears banal by comparison. This awakening has caused those rare Ahrimanes who interact with other vampires to serve as guides or teachers, acting as intermediaries to the world beyond the dark and lonely existence of most vampires. While the Ahrimanes find comfort and solace in the insight granted by this power, most other vampires find the knowledge disturbing and unsettling as they realize how limiting and stale their reality is.
Learning Spiritus
: This discipline may only be learned by Ahrimanes who take the Ahrimane merit Seekers of the Hidden (see
VTM Volume 2 Issue 1, page 32

). This is due to the extraordinary amount of spiritual journeying involved which requires having undergone the Ahrimane creation rites. As an addendum to the original text of the Seekers of the Hidden merit, you may only teach Spiritus to other Ahrimanes who purchase this merit. This discipline may not be learned through the Sabbat setting rules for diablerie.
Beast Spirits

: Spiritus often refers to Beast Spirits. These spirits have some similarities to Umbral spirits but are different in several ways. Thematically, Beast Spirits are the spirits of animals that have been magically awakened by the Spiritus power Tame Spirit. Once an Ahrimane learns Tame Spirit, she obtains a Beast Spirit. Beast Spirits have some commonalities with traditional spirits but have several notable differences. Beast Spirits are created using the Animal Retainer rules with the following additions that represent their spiritual nature:
Beast Spirits have the following properties:

Beast Spirits are considered supernatural creatures, not mortals. Powers that have an increased effect on mortals do not have those increased effects when used on a Beast Spirit. Powers that affect Umbral spirits affect Beast Spirits.

Beast Spirits are the same size as the animals they represent. Their habitat is most often limited to that of their counterparts in the real-world, but this is not a strict rule. It is perfectly feasible for an Ahrimane in North America to have a tiger, pangolin, or narwhal follower.
Beast Spirits do not have access to Garou Gifts; they instead employ bestial spiritual powers more similar to Disciplines (see the Types of Beast Spirits below.)Â

Beast Spirits are immune to Subsume the Spirit and all other powers intended to act solely on animals; however, they are treated like animals for the purposes of Feral Whispers or similar communication powers.

Beast Spirits cannot see across the Gauntlet, but instinctually remain near you in the Umbra. Beast Spirits can understand you without assistance but cannot understand others unless the speaker is using Wild Eyes, Feral Whispers, or a similar power. As such, their ability to relay information as spies is limited. The Storyteller will portray your Beast Spirit if it is employed as a spy.Â

Beast Spirits utilize Gnosis to fuel disciplines and may spend Gnosis to heal in the same way a vampire uses Blood. Beast Spirits have a Gnosis pool equal to twice their Stock NPC rating. Beast Spirits begin each night with their Gnosis pool refreshed.Â
Unless they have manifested, Beast Spirits are invisible to anyone that does not possess the ability to see into the Umbra.Â

Beast Spirits can manifest in the physical world by spending a point of Gnosis as a simple action. While manifested they appear as normal specimens of the animal their spirit form represents and can interact with others and can be attacked and killed.
If a Beast Spirit dies while manifested or is destroyed in the Umbra, it reforms in one month. If a Beast Spirit is dismissed by a Spiritus user, it cannot be summoned again.
Types of Beast Spirits
: There are three types of Beast Spirits. They are:
Aggressive Animals

: These animals are strong and formidable, typically predators. For example, the Beast Spirits of alligators and grizzly bears would be considered Aggressive Animals. When building an Aggressive Animal Beast Spirit, you may purchase one discipline specialization for the Beast Spirit in either Celerity or Potence and the Beast Spirit gains the Strength attribute focus. This is an exception to the rule preventing Stock NPCs from possessing attribute focuses.
Curious Animals

: These animals are clever and perceptive. They are often smaller, but not necessarily so. Some examples are a fox or a pigeon. When building a Curious Animal Beast Spirit, you may purchase one discipline specialization for the Beast Spirit in either Auspex or Obfuscate and the Beast Spirit gains the Perception attribute focus. This is an exception to the rule preventing Stock NPCs from possessing attribute focuses.
Defensive Animals

: Stalwart, brave, and resolute are some of the qualities of defensive animals. These creatures do not need to be robust but are often animals known for their loyalty. A turtle or a dog are some examples of Defensive Animals. When building this Beast Spirit, you may purchase one discipline specialization for the Beast Spirit in either Celerity or Fortitude and the Beast Spirit gains the Stamina attribute focus. This is an exception to the rule preventing Stock NPCs from possessing attribute focuses. In addition, Defensive Animals may utilize the Assist Defender mass combat tactic as an exception to the rules prohibiting Stock NPCs from doing so.

fields.testPool: The Spiritus practitioner uses her Social attribute + Occult skill versus the targetâs Social attribute + Willpower.

fields.title: Auspex

content.value:
âI touched the knife, and a wave of emotions and memories washed through me. I saw her, Donny. I saw her as they were chopping her apartâ¦â
â Warren Yam, Toreador Primogen of Dallas

A predatorâs senses must be tremendously acute to track prey in the night. The five senses of smell, touch, taste, sight, and hearing can all be sharpened with the use of Auspex. This improved awareness can even go beyond the physical senses, expanding a vampireâs powers of concentration, perception, and consciousness itself beyond the ability of mortals. Such
heightened awareness can grasp subtle textures of movement as well as emotional states, transcending ordinary mental acuity. Auspex can also pierce mental distractions and illusions, such as those created by the disciplines of Obfuscate or Chimeristry.

Auspex and Obfuscate/Chimeristry: If you are attempting to use Heightened Senses to pierce supernatural concealment, your target may opt to use her Mental attribute + Stealth as a defensive test pool rather than her Mental attribute + Willpower. If you are attempting to pierce an illusion, your target may opt to use her Social attribute + Subterfuge instead of her Social attribute + Willpower.

fields.testPool: Auspex Test Pool: The vampire wielding Auspex uses her Mental attribute + Investigation versus the targetâs Mental attribute + Willpower.

content.value:
No longer confined to the physical plane, you can project your senses and awareness outside of your body. Thus untethered, your consciousness roams various planes of thought, allowing
you to view the world as though you were an incorporeal spirit. Without the concerns of mass and matter, you easily pass through any physical barrier and move at the speed of thought to any place under the gaze of the moon.

To activate Psychic Projection, you must spend 1 point of Blood and expend a standard action meditating. This expenditure allows the character to project her awareness outside of her physical form. While a character is in Psychic Projection, her body lies in a torpor-like state. If her body is damaged, the Psychic Projection automatically ends, and the individualâs consciousness returns instantly to her physical form.

A characterâs Psychic Projection is an idealized version of her normal appearance. While this image may be clothed in golden robes, shine with a halo of silver light, or have shaggy fur, itâs always recognizable as your character. A psychic form travels at roughly 50 miles per hour and can pass through solid objects, but cannot interact with the physical world in any way. The only powers you can use while in Psychic Projection are the first 4 dots of Auspex; you cannot use other disciplines, elder powers of Auspex, or techniques (even those based on Auspex) while in this state.

A psychic form is invisible to those without Heightened Senses or similar supernatural abilities. You can spend 1 Blood to manifest (your torporous body expends this Blood),
making your psychic form visible, as though materially present for one turn. While the character is still intangible and cannot physically interact, a manifested psychic form can be seen and heard normally and can be targeted by Mental and Social powers by those in the material world.

Individuals with Heightened Senses or similar supernatural abilities can see the vague outline of an individual in Psychic Projection even when that individual has not manifested, but the observer cannot make out details, see gestures, or hear the projected characterâs voice unless she manifests. Two individuals who are both in Psychic Projection can interact with one another normally, and may even engage in combat through punching or other unarmed Physical attacks. A successful blow from another psychic individual doesnât inflict damage; it instead costs the victim 1 Willpower.

If the victim runs out of Willpower, her Psychic Projection immediately ends and cannot be reactivated for 10 minutes. Remember that only the first 4 dots of Auspex can be used in Psychic Projection; a character cannot use other powers (even against other projecting individuals) and possesses no equipment other than simple clothing while in this state.

In addition to Auspex, you may utilize the first 2 dots of any Mental or Social in-clan discipline you possess. This is an exception to the rule against using other disciplines while in Psychic Projection. Your character uses these powers normally when targeting others in the psychic plane. If your character manifests, she can also use these disciplines on targets in the material world while she is manifested. Potence, Celerity, and Fortitude cannot ever be used while in Psychic Projection, nor can powers that require touch, unless used against other Psychically Projected individuals.

Souls and wraiths are vital to the Giovanni economy, but they are useful for more than just powering Dark Vessels and Deathly Devices. For a talented necromancer, wraiths can be consumed utterly, turning their pathos into blood and absorbing their corpus into your own flesh.

You may bind a wraith within you instead of within an object. This is a special form of possession which you maintain control over, despite being the host. Spend a point of Blood and your standard action to initiate the bond, targeting either a visible wraith or one you have imprisoned in a Dark Vessel or Deathly Device. If the wraith is unwilling, you must succeed in an opposed challenge. If you succeed, the wraith possesses your body rendering any Dark Vessel or Deathly Device it previously possessed inert, and you may choose one of the wraithâs discipline specializations (if the wraith does not have additional discipline specializations, all wraiths have access to the first 2 dots of Dementation). You may utilize any level of the chosen discipline specialization for the next hour, after which the power ends and the wraith is freed. You must still adhere to any restrictions or conditions of that power, such as requiring Gaze and Focus when using Dread Gaze and cannot use it during Celerity rounds. Both you and the wraith must pay any costs in Blood and Pathos associated with the power. If one of you is unable to spend Blood or Pathos, you cannot use the power.

If you enter into torpor while this power is active, both you and the wraith are drawn into a Harrowing. The Storyteller will construct and run this scene based on your background. This may involve you remaining torpid beyond the current game session. During this time, you lose all awareness of your body, including that granted by the Awareness skill, and cannot reawaken until you have resolved the scene. However, your body can still be moved or destroyed. Once the scene is resolved, you enter a normal state of torpor.
You may only use this power once per evening, and you may only have a single wraith within your body at a given time. While assimilated, the wraith cannot escape or use the Possession power.Â

You can utilize Assimilate twice in the course of a single evening. However, you cannot benefit from two uses of Assimilate at the same time. If you utilize Assimilate a second time the benefits of the first usage are immediately lost.

fields.title: Sanguine Harvest

content.value: As immortals, vampires do not need water or food to exist, but that does not mean they do not long for a taste of what they once craved in their breathing days, a connection to their lost human life. Through centuries of study in alchemy and botany, the bioarcanists have perfected the means of infusing plants with vampiric life, causing them to produce food, beverage, healing salves, herbal supplements, and even poisons all fit for vampire consumption and use. This creation of vampire life within plants is the basis for mastery and understanding of the Green Path of thaumaturgy.

Spend a point of Blood and use your standard action to feed your Blood to a single plant. As a result, the plant becomes a ghouled version of itself; however, it does not become a Stock NPC nor can it acquire disciplines. Instead, it is infused with life and vitality, growing healthy and strong. You may maintain any number of ghouled plants, creating lush gardens and exquisite greenhouses for your enjoyment.Â

You may also cultivate a small number of your plants to generate twisted fruit, seeds, vegetables, or legumes with mysterious or enhanced properties. You may spend a single downtime action to cultivate your plants. If you do, at the start of the next game session you may harvest a single plant, plus a number of additional ghouled plants equal to your dots in the Science: Botany skill. Bioarcanists are often particular about which plants they imbue with various effects and certain fairytale enthusiasts are known to deal exclusively in apples, while others maintain the pomegranate is the superior vessel. Regardless of their form, these items can be consumed by vampires, but do not provide them with a nutritional benefit unless otherwise stated. Choose one of the following benefits:
Aesthetic

: The specimen you create is especially beautiful or otherwise captivating to the senses. It has a special appearance, taste, fragrance, or any combination thereof which you may choose. You create 5 of these items per harvest. These items can trigger the Toreador clan weakness. For example, flowers can trigger the Toreador clan weakness with their appearance, while other items may need to be consumed or processed into oils or perfumes to captivate a Degenerate.
Blood Sack

: Your plants are able to create a fruit capable of providing sustenance to vampires. Biting into it and consuming its juices restores 1 Blood point. If you have the personal Masquerade Merit you can eat the fruit instead to gain its benefits, though you must still vomit it later. However, due to vampiric physiology, a vampire cannot stomach consuming more than 3 items with this quality in a single night and will vomit any additional Blood Sacks beyond the third receiving no benefit from the consumption. You can create 3 of these items per harvest.Â
Bountiful
: You cultivate edible foods in a substantial volume. Each unit supplies one nightâs worth of food for up to four humans or human-sized herbivores. Each harvest has 7 items.Â
Hallucinogenic
: Ingesting such an item causes potent hallucinations in humans and vampires. Each harvest has 3 items.
Knock Out
: Ingesting this item causes a temporary loss of consciousness. This does not affect vampires. Each harvest has 3 items.
Restorative
: This item can be made into a salve that cures 1 point of damage regardless of type. It can be used on both vampires and mortals. Each harvest yields 1 use.
Toxin
: This item is poisonous (Virility 10) and harmful when ingested by mortals or vampires. Each harvest has 3 doses.

Consuming or using one of these items requires a standard action. Once harvested, these items are perishable and will lose all potency after 1 month. This duration cannot be extended through mundane or magical means. Items created in this way cannot serve as a sympathetic link to their creator and do not create a blood bond when consumed nor do they turn mortals into ghouls.
Your specimens are especially abundant. You gain an additional 2 items per harvest.

fields.testPool: Mental attribute + Occult skill versus targetâs Physical attribute + Dodge skill

fields.title: Boughs Below
